title: The House on Mango Street
description: A series of interconnected vignettes narrated by a young Latina girl growing up in Chicago, reflecting on her community and her own identity.
author: Sandra Cisneros

title: Half of a Yellow Sun
description: A gripping novel set in Nigeria during the Biafran War, weaving together the lives of multiple characters affected by the conflict.
author: Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie

title: Home Fire
description: A contemporary reimagining of Sophocles' Antigone, set in present-day London and dealing with themes of love, family, and extremism.
author: Kamila Shamsie

title: The Girl with the Louding Voice
description: A powerful tale of a young Nigerian girl's fight for education and self-determination in a society where girls are often devalued.
author: Abi Dar√©

title: The Moor's Account
description: A historical novel based on the true story of Mustafa al-Zamori, a Moroccan slave who was part of Cabeza de Vaca's expedition to America in the 16th century.
author: Laila Lalami

title: An Unnecessary Woman
description: A novel about an elderly Lebanese woman who has spent her life translating Western literature into Arabic and reflects on her past, her loves, and her city, Beirut.
author: Rabih Alameddine

title: The Architect's Apprentice
description: A captivating historical novel set in 16th-century Istanbul, following the life of Jahan, a young Indian boy brought to the Ottoman Empire as a gift to the Sultan's chief architect.
author: Elif Shafak

title: Their Eyes Were Watching God
description: The story of Janie Crawford's journey to self-discovery and independence as an African-American woman in the early 20th century.
author: Zora Neale Hurston
